column4: I've managed to install the proprietarty ATI Radeon 9250 driver and I've got it running, but when I enable "videooverlay" in the device section of my xorg.conf file, all video and other overlayed stuff (like Tv-card) is of a wrong aspect ratio : I can only see the top half of the image. Where do I fix/configure this Xvideo stuff ?
you definitely haven't managed to install a proprietary ati radeon 9250 drievr since such a thing doesn't exist
aha and woops... I mean the ATI binary drivers from their own corporate website
restricted drivers, is that the word I had to use ?
a) that's still untrue since those won't work with 9250  b) ubuntu has fglrx as restricted drievrs. for help with ati.com ones, ask ati. they made that crud, they support it

fglrx - I selected my card and OS at ati.com and they send me that 8.28 driver for their radeon cards. Downgraded ubuntu to edgy so that I was using an older kernel / Xserver - the newer ones weren't supported by that driver
not to mention you can't downgrade. you can only reinstall which is a sucky thing to do
fglrx especially such an old driver is a lot owrse than current ubuntu drvers. eg. no compiz and bugs like the one you encoutnered probably
I would love to, but what is the proper driver ? From what I've read, the fglrx driver from the ubuntu repos. doesn't support the 9250 anymore.
That's the one I was using in the first place, but I needed TV-out support.
Is there a way to get TV-out support in that ati driver, other than going through the complicated-looking process of patching it ?
thx, I will look into that (whatever it may be - I'll search google)
I'm going away but I think you pointed me in the right direction, thanks a lot !
